result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Andrew R Mcfaul was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for unpaid court obligations.  If the debit is not paid or payment arrangements have not been met, the Clerk of Courts office will refer the amount due to the WDOR for collection action.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

11:57 AM Defendant Andrew R Mcfaul in custody, appears via videoconferencing from Price County with Attorney Liesl E. Nelson in Court.  ADA Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises Defendant of right to appear in person, Defendant waives.  Court finds that Defendant freely and voluntarily waives personal appearance.  Court notes review of Revocation Order and Warrant.  ADA Walker states position; requests one year in PCJ w/credit for 261 days.  Advises of violations.  Atty. Nelson states position.  Defendant makes statement.  Court sentences Defendant, orders one year in PCJ, credit for 261 days.  Good time granted so 12 days yet to serve.  Release date of 01/26/20.  Defendant may serve in Price County Jail if at no cost to Pierce County.  Fine of $1714 to be converted to civil judgment.  Appeal rights given.  Adjourned at 12:08 AM
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 14, 2020 at 11:45 am.
Atty. Liesl Nelson.

10:46 Defendant Andrew R Mcfaul in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15TR1012 and 15TR1013 heard at this time. Thorie: guilty to Ct#1 in 15CF180 information. Dismiss Ct#2 and 15TR1012-1013. 3 years probation: minimum 6 months jail, $1744, 3 year revocation of DL and IID, AODA and driver safety plan. DNA sample and surcharge. Nelson and Def agree.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to Ct#1 in the information in 15CF180; Nelson stipulates to a factual basis.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty of Ct#1 in the information of 15CF180. Dismisses Ct#2 in 15CF180 and 15TR1012-1013. Thorie and Nelson address sentencing. Court: S/W 3 years probation. 3 year revocation of Driver License.  IID TO COMMENCE WHEN THE DEF OBTAINS ANY TYPE OF VALID DL, OR WHEN THE DEF CHOOSES TO DRIVE W/O A VALID DL; SUBJECT TO FURTHER PENALTY  IID for a period of  3 yrs to any vehicle owned, operated or registered to the def. $50 IID surcharge. $1744 fine and DNA surcharge, due over the length of probation.  Conditions: any conditions set by agent, 6 months jail stayed until no later than April 8, 2016 at 7pm; huber allowed after 1st 48 hours under the rules of the Sheriff. AODA and Driver Safety plan, comply. DNA Sample. Defendant may serve his jail time in Eau Claire, Dunn, Pepin or St Croix, as long as there is no charge to Pierce County and the sheriff approves.   Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
Plea hearing at 02-09-2016 10:30 am.
State's
Pre-trial conference at 11-30-2015 03:15 pm.

Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant.  Additional charge on Information.  Court reviews charges and minimum and maximum penalties with defendant.    Defendant has a copy of the information  and waives reading of the information.    Defendant enters not guilty plea to Count 1 and Count 2 at preliminary hearing.  Not guilty plea received by the court.    Pretrial Conference to be set.    The bond will continue as ordered.  Bond conditions are reviewed with defendant.

2:39 p.m.  Defendant Andrew R Mcfaul in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Written waiver of preliminary hearing is filed and the court reviews with the defendant.    Court finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing.    The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.
